title: Synthetic Recap
body:
PHOENIX – On a night where the final score told a story of utter dominance, one man authored a legend. Kevin Johnson didn't just lead the Phoenix Suns to a 118-87 demolition of the Golden State Warriors; he delivered a performance for the ages, a singular, breathtaking display of offensive firepower that left an entire arena in awe.

From the opening tip, it was clear something special was brewing. Johnson, the Suns' floor general, was a blur of motion, slicing through the Warrior defense at will. He wasn’t just scoring; he was orchestrating a masterpiece, finishing with a staggering 44 points. Each drive to the basket was a lesson in precision and power, leaving defenders grasping at air. The Suns' offense ran exclusively through him, and he carried the load with historic efficiency.

While Johnson’s eruption was the main event, the Suns received crucial support. Hot Rod Williams controlled the paint with a dominant 17-point, 14-rebound double-double, and Wesley Person stretched the floor, chipping in 16 points. The Warriors, simply overwhelmed, had no answer. Latrell Sprewell’s 22 points were a lone bright spot in an otherwise forgettable night for the visitors.

As the final buzzer sounded on the 118-87 rout, all eyes were on the stat sheet and the remarkable number beside Kevin Johnson’s name. Forty-four points. It was more than a win; it was a statement. On this night, Kevin Johnson wasn't just a player; he was the entire game.
